question.question-text: Which of the sentences below expresses the essential information in the highlighted sentence in paragraph 1?

answer-list.answer-text: They originally intended to make computers only for themselves, but soon they were making computers for friends.
Because computer technology was widely available to consumers, they decided to limit the scope of their production.
Their plan changed from one of assembling computers for those already knowledgeable in computers to introducing computers to those who were not.
Their goal of making computers for broad markets was clearly set from the start.

question.explain-text: The highlighted sentence states that this goal soon changed, which means that their plan changed, that their initial idea was to assemble computers for…personal computer hobbyists, which means that their initial plan was one of assembling computers for those already knowledgeable in computers, and that the plans changed to one of making computer technology more widely available to nontechnical consumers, which means that it changed to introducing computers to those who were not knowledgeable in computers. The third answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

insert-text.b: They intended to change this public perception of computers.

question.explain-text: The passage states that most consumers at the time thought of computers as playthings for hobbyists and as too expensive and too complex for general use. A sentence mentioning this public perception of computers would logically follow such an idea. The last square in paragraph 1 is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: Which of the sentences below expresses the essential information in the highlighted sentence in paragraph 2?

answer-text.exp: The product name was chosen to make their product appealing to the nontechnical market.

answer-list.answer-text: The product name was selected to put the company into different markets from other computer companies.
Because the company was not technologically oriented, a product name was chosen to clarify this.
A name was chosen that would make the product seem less threatening to competitors.

question.explain-text: The highlighted sentences states that the name Apple was selected because it was nontechnical, nonthreatening, and would not be off-putting to their intended market. This means that the product name was chosen to make their product more appealing to the nontechnical market. The first answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

insert-text.b: It may seem surprising, but that was all that was needed to start their company.

question.explain-text: The passage states that Jobs and Wozniak raised $1,300 to start a company. A sentence stating that that was all that was needed to start their company would logically follow such an idea. The second square in paragraph 2 is therefore the answer to this question.

question.question-text: Which of the sentences below expresses the essential information in the highlighted sentence in paragraph 3?

answer-list.answer-text: Even though Apple I users needed to have a lot of technical knowledge, orders surprisingly reached 600.
Computer hobbyists preferred to use the Apple I because it allowed them to make use of their technical knowledge.
Because of the limited technical ability of the Apple I computer, it was unbelievable that 600 were ordered.
The owners of the company needed a surprising amount of technical knowledge to reach 600 customers.

question.explain-text: The highlighted sentence states that the Apple I required the user to have a fair amount of technical knowledge, which means that Apple I users needed to have a lot of technical knowledge, and that orders for this machine…quickly reached the unbelievably high level of 600, which means that orders surprisingly reached 600. The first answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

insert-text.b: This machine was named the Apple I.

question.explain-text: The passage mentions their first model. A sentence stating that this machine was named the Apple I would logically follow such an idea. The second square in paragraph 4 is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: Which of the sentences below expresses the essential information in the highlighted sentence in paragraph 4?

answer-list.answer-text: The special ad-on devices and software programs caused demand for the Apple II to increase.
Because of the popularity of the Apple II, a number of other companies began working on creating competing models.
Without the devices and software prepared by other companies, the Apple II was unusable.
Because the Apple II was so popular, other companies created products to go along with it.

question.explain-text: The highlighted sentence states that demand for this new version of the Apple quickly soared, which means that the Apple II was so popular, and that this inspired numerous other companies to created ad-on devices and software programs that could be used in conjunction with it, which means that other companies created products to go along with it. The last answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: Which of the sentences below expresses the essential information in the highlighted sentence in paragraph 5?

answer-list.answer-text: The company's personnel focused its attention on leaders, on investments, on marketing to computer hobbyists, and on improving initial computer purchases over peripherals.
Because their innovative products were already developed, the company needed to pay attention to developing new markets for their products.

answer-text.exp: The company had a strategic plan that involved emphasis on strong personnel, innovation, research and development, market expansion, and development of peripheral products.

answer-list.answer-text: The company's plan was to rely more heavily on innovation and research than to work on developing markets.

question.explain-text: The highlighted sentences mentions the company's strategic plan, and its emphasis on personnel,…innovation,…research and development…, the desire to expand their market… and …peripheral products. This means that the company had a strategic plan that involved emphasis on strong personnel, innovation, research and development, market expansion, and development of peripheral products. The third answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

insert-text.b: To do so, they brought in a number of new employees.

question.explain-text: The passage states that Jobs and Wozniak decided to expand their company. A sentence that mentions a number of new employees would logically follow such an idea. The second square in paragraph 5 is therefore the best answer to this question.

insert-text.b: This represented an unbelievable 14-fold increase in only two years.

question.explain-text: The passage states that revenues…grew to $8 million in 1978 and escalated exponentially to $117 million in 1980. A sentence mentioning an unbelievable 14-fold increase in only two years would logically follow such an idea. The second square in paragraph 6 is therefore the best answer to this question.
